31 October 2008

How Global Compact Local Networks liaise with the Global Compact Office

As it was announced at the ALNF in Bonn the way Global Compact Local Networks (GCLNs) liaise with Global Compact Office (GCO) has been reorganized. As we move forward we want to make sure that all networks get the most out of the support that the GCO can give while at the same time making sure that the support is given in the best and most coherent fashion. Within the GCO Network team there will be two regional managers who will be responsible for the liaison with the local networks and it is organized in the following way: Americas (North and South), Africa and Middle East will liaise with Jonas Haertle at haertle@un.org Europe (East and West), Asia and Australia will liaise with Nessa Whelan at whelan@un.org     

The network team within the GCO will make sure that events and activities are registered in the Knowledge Sharing System and made available for all local networks to be shared and learned from. The Knowledge Sharing System as demonstrated in Bonn should be able to help you in drafting your annual activity report by the end of this year. At the next ALNF in Turkey you will be provided with full access to the system, including updating information and uploading documents on events and activities.

Outcomes from the VI Annual Local Network Forum, Bonn, 21-22 October 2008    

The Global Compact Office would like to thank all those who attended the recent VI Annual Local Networks Forum (ALNF) in Bonn, Germany on 21-22 October. With approximately 220 participants representing 70 Global Compact Local Networks (GCLNs) it was the largest ALNF to date. We would like to convey our sincerest appreciation to Deutsche Gesellschaft fur Technische Zusammenarbeit (GTZ) GmbH, the German Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development and the Fundacio Forum - Barcelona Center for the Support of the UN Global Compact for their generous support of the event. On behalf of everyone involved and all the participants present, we would particularly like to thank our wonderful hosts, Deutsche Post World Net Headquarters, for the use of their fantastic conference venue and site logistics which undoubtedly contributed to the overall success of the event. Please find all available presentations of the VI ALNF on the Global Compact website. The outcomes report will be made available shortly.

Change of date for the ALNF 2009    

As announced in Bonn, the ALNF for 2009 will take place in Istanbul, Turkey. Due to conflicting events we have to reconsider the exact date and would like to propose the following options:

1) 2-4 June 2008

2) 9-11 June 2008

3) 16-18 June 2008

Please let us know by emailing Nessa Whelan at whelan@un.org by 7th Nov 2008 if any of these dates would NOT be feasible for your Network.

LABOUR

ILO International Training on the "Labour Dimension of CSR: From Principles to Practice

and

New ILO guidance material for business and employers on how to tackle forced labour

For more details on each    

The ILO International Training Centre in Turin is organising a training course on the "Labour Dimension of CSR: From Principles to Practice". The training is intended to deepen the understanding of the labour principles and will take place 10-12 December 2008 in Turin.

For more information, please contact Ms. Maria Vasquez of the Turin Centre at M.Vasquez@itcilo.org

The ILO has just introduced a handbook which seeks to meet the needs of employers organisations and individual companies worldwide for guidance on addressing forced labour and human trafficking. It provides practical tools and material for business actors of all kinds, identifying what is and is not forced labour, why it is a significant concern for business, and the actions that can be taken to address it. We encourage Local Networks to bring it to the attention of participants.

AFRICA

Workshop - Fighting Corruption through Collective Action: Practical Strategies for Companies?, 18-19 November 2008, and Progress and Value Workshop, 20 November 2008, to be held in Lagos, Nigeria. Travel and accommodation costs for GCLN Focal Points will be covered by the World Bank Institute and the workshops are free of charge.    

The Global Compact and the World Bank Institute invites all African GCLN Focal Points to this innovative regional workshop followed by a 1-day Progress-and-Value workshop. To apply to participate please complete the application form and send it by Wednesday, November 5, 2008 to Michael Jarvis, email: mjarvis@worldbank.org fax: +1 202 522 2164. Please click here for further information and the application form.

ASIA

Inaugural meeting of the Clinton Global Initiative in Asia (CGI Asia)     

The first overseas meeting of CGI will be convened by President Clinton in Asia on December 2-3, 2008. A select group of distinguished Asian Global Compact business leaders will be invited by President Clinton to participate in this inaugural meeting of CGI Asia. The meeting will explore the growing capacity of leaders in Asia to address major modern challenges including education, public health, and energy and climate change.

To obtain more information about CGI Asia, please contact Justine.Chao@clintonglobalinitiative.org or Rachel.Fleishman@clintonglobalinitiative.org
